original: Elfving, Folke Rolf August, taxeringsintendent, Göteborg, f. 7/8/03 i Gbg av landsfiskal Albert S. E. o. Mär-tha Wallgren. G. 1. 29 m. Signe Rho-din, d. 41; 2. 43 m. Britten Enander. Barn: Rolf f. 30, Stig 33, Stefan 46. — Stud:ex. v. Gbgs h. real 21, jur. kand. v. Upps. univ. 26. Tingstjg. v. Askims m. fl. häradsrätt 26-29, anst. å kndskont. i Gbg sed. 29, tax:intend. där sed. 44. Sekr. h. Gbgs mus. sed. 36, ilär. v. soc. inst. i Gbg sed. 45. Skr.: Om skattetrycket i n. Bohusläns |landskommuner (37), Om avskrivn. v. in-komsttax. (39), upps. i Sv. Skattetidn., Förvaltn :rättsi. Tidskr. o. Nord. Adm. Tidskr. m. fl.
translated: Elfving, Folke Rolf August, tax inspector, Gothenburg, born August 7th, 1903 in Gothenburg to district fiscal Albert S. E. and Märtha Wallgren. Married 1st in 1929 to Signe Rhodin, who died in 1941; 2nd in 1943 to Britten Enander. Children: Rolf born in 1930, Stig in 1933, Stefan in 1946. Graduated from Gothenburg's Higher Real Gymnasium in 1921 and earned a law degree from Uppsala University in 1926. Worked as a court clerk in Askim and other districts from 1926-1929, then employed at the tax office in Gothenburg from 1929 and tax inspector there from 1944. Secretary of the Gothenburg Museum from 1936 and lecturer at the Social Institute in Gothenburg since 1945. Author of "On the tax burden in northern Bohuslän's rural communities" (1937), "On the deductions for income tax" (1939), published in Swedish Tax Magazine, Administration Law Magazine, and Nordic Administrative Magazine, among others.

publications.name: On the tax burden in northern Bohuslän's rural communities
On the deductions for income tax
